abstract.p: Correction of July 16 Q&A column on deducting property taxes on tax returns; rules explained

block.p: An answer in the Q&A column last Sunday about shareholders' ability to claim interest and property-tax deductions on their federal income tax returns misstated the classification of interest earned on a reserve fund. As noted, at least 80 percent of a co-op's income must come from shareholders in order for them to claim the deductions. Interest on a reserve fund is not countable as coming from shareholders, no matter how the fund is used.
